result.execSummary:
The defendant Damon J Kehoe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Damon J Kehoe is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Damon J Kehoe was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damon J Kehoe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 5 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment ONLY. Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $350.00 plus all mandatory costs and surcharges by 6/7/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 12 months.    

Defendant to report by 12/11/2015 by 5:00 p.m.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Sentencing Referral Form and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.

Defendant Damon J Kehoe in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Count 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed.

As to Count 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Damon J Kehoe in court with attorney Adam C Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
Court is in trial on another matter.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damon J Kehoe in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel just started treatment and needs more time to review offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damon J Kehoe in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Adam c Essling in court, defendant Damon J Kehoe not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing however, the defendant was not produced.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damon J Kehoe in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time to receive sqaud video. Defense counsel also needs additional time to review offer with his cliet.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Damon J Kehoe in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-02-2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription,  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-22-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Damon J Kehoe
Current: 3506 4th Avenue, South Milwaukee, WI 53172   (Effective: 05-06-2015)
Prior: 3506 4th Avenue, South Milwaukee, WI 53172

Defendant Damon J Kehoe in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/6/15 @ 1:30 pm
